title: Shah Halal Food Becomes Official Partner of MetLife Stadium , Bringing Authentic Halal Cuisine to Giants and Jets Fans
body_text:
Shah's Halal Food Becomes Official Partner of MetLife Stadium, Bringing Authentic Halal Cuisine to Giants and Jets Fans
Partnership introduces three premium food service locations within the stadium
AMITYVILLE, N.Y., Sept. 12, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Shah's Halal Food today announced a new partnership with MetLife Stadium, home of the New York Jets and New York Football Giants, to bring NYC's authentic Halal cuisine to the venue's dining options. The collaboration features three strategically located food service areas throughout the stadium, enhancing the culinary experience for the diverse fanbase that calls MetLife Stadium home.
The flagship Shah's Halal service stand can be found in West Hall, positioned immediately inside the MetLife Gate, in addition to two prime concourse locations at Sections 126 and 314. The menu includes their heaping platters, available with chicken, lamb, and falafel in addition to gyros, pakora chips and their signature sauces.
"We are thrilled to partner with Shah's Halal to offer superior Halal food to our guests," says Ron VanDeVeen, President and CEO of MetLife Stadium. "We are always looking for ways to elevate the fan experience and are excited to expand our Middle Eastern culinary options through this great partnership."
The partnership represents a significant milestone in MetLife Stadium's commitment to providing diverse, inclusive dining options that reflect the multicultural community it serves. Shah's Halal Food brings years of experience in delivering authentic Middle Eastern cuisine, ensuring that fans who appreciate Halal dining will have flavorful options during their stadium visits.
"We are honored to bring our signature NYC style Halal experience to one of the most iconic venues in sports and entertainment," said Khalid Mashriqi, CEO of Shah's Halal Food. "Our goal is to create an exceptional culinary journey for every fan and event guest, offering the same quality and authenticity that has made Shah's Halal part of New York City's food culture. This partnership allows us to serve our community at the highest level while introducing new guests to the rich flavors of traditional Halal food."
The Shah's Halal locations are expected to begin operations in advance of the upcoming NFL season, with menu offerings that will include traditional favorites alongside stadium-friendly options designed specifically for the game-day experience.
MetLife Stadium continues to set the standard for premium venue experiences, and this partnership with Shah's Halal Food demonstrates the facility's ongoing commitment to serving its diverse guest community with exceptional dining options.
About Shah's Halal Food: Shah's Halal Food is the world's fastest-growing QSR halal restaurant brand, boasting over 170 locations globally with 118 establishments across the U.S. and Canada. What began as a single food cart in Richmond Hill, Queens in 2005 has evolved into a culinary phenomenon that pioneered the introduction of halal cuisine to mainstream American dining. At the heart of Shah's success are signature family recipes that masterfully blend authentic flavors with accessible service, creating an experience that honors tradition while embracing innovation. Instagram & TikTok: @shahshalalfood
About MetLife Stadium: MetLife Stadium, located in East Rutherford, NJ, is the home of the New York Giants and New York Jets and has the largest seating capacity in the NFL (82,500). The venue is one of the busiest stadiums in the world and ranked No. 1 in the U.S. for both tickets sold and ticket revenue in 2024 per Pollstar. MetLife Stadium was named "Highest Grossing Stadium of the Year" nine times by Billboard and "Venue of the Year" by StadiumBusiness. In 2021, MetLife Stadium became the first NFL Stadium to join the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change's Sports for Climate Action Framework, which aims to achieve global greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions reductions goals.
About the New York Football Giants: A cornerstone franchise of the National Football League, the New York Football Giants began play in 1925. The Giants have won eight championships: 1927, 1934, 1938, 1956, 1986, 1990, 2007 and 2011. After twice winning two titles in five years, the Giants are the only NFL franchise with Super Bowl victories in four consecutive decades. Headquartered at the Quest Diagnostics Training Center in East Rutherford, N.J., the Giants enter their 101st season of play this fall.
About the New York Jets: The New York Jets were founded in 1959 as the New York Titans, an original member of the American Football League (AFL). The Jets won Super Bowl III, defeating the NFL's Baltimore Colts in 1969 â€“ a victory many believe led to the 1970 merger of the AFL and NFL that set the foundation for today's league. The organization takes great pride in a long-standing, year-round commitment to their community by implementing impactful programs that will positively influence the lives of young men and women in the tri-state area, particularly in disadvantaged communities. The New York Jets are headquartered at the Atlantic Health Jets Training Center in Florham Park, N.J.
